abstract: Russia expands sanctions against Turkey in order to stop new development by Turkish companies in Russia, and slow down Turkey's tourism efforts in country as well; exemptions are made for some skyscrapers, soccer stadiums and other projects, which suggests there is limit to how far Russia will go in pressing forward on sanctions, given how deeply invested Turkish companies are in Russian infrastructure development.
lead_paragraph: The additional measures bar Turkish construction companies from signing new contracts after Jan. 1, and also prohibit Turkish citizens or companies from operating tourism agencies in Russia.

headline.main: Russia Expands Sanctions Against Turkey After Downing of Jet
headline.print_headline: Kremlin Widens Sanctions Imposed on Turkish Firms

snippet: The additional measures bar Turkish construction companies from signing new contracts after Jan. 1, and also prohibit Turkish citizens or companies from operating tourism agencies in Russia.
